contentrichtext.text: {{coord|35.683828|N|139.702320|E|display=title}} {{infobox japan station |namerom = Yoyogi |name = 代々木 |image = YoyogiSta200505.jpg |imagesize = 300px |caption = Yoyogi Station viewed from Shinjuku |pref = Tokyo |ward = Shibuya |address = 1 Yoyogi |jaloc = 東京都渋谷区代々木1丁目 |postal = |open = 1906 |close = |oldname = |presentname = |station_number = E-26 (Toei) |operator = [[JR East]], [[Toei Subway]] |line = [[Chūō-Sōbu Line]], [[Yamanote Line]] [[Toei Ōedo Line]] |stats = |statsnote = |bus = }} {{nihongo|'''Yoyogi Station'''|代々木駅|Yoyogi-eki}} is a railway station in [[Shibuya, Tokyo]], Japan, operated by the [[East Japan Railway Company]] (JR East) and [[Tokyo Metropolitan Bureau of Transportation]] (Toei). It is station E-26 under Toei's numbering system. ==Station layout == ===JR East=== The JR East station consists of two ground-level [[side platform]]s on either side of an [[island platform]], serving four tracks in total. # [[Yamanote Line]] (for [[Shinjuku Station|Shinjuku]], [[Ikebukuro Station|Ikebukuro]]) # Yamanote Line (for [[Shibuya Station|Shibuya]], [[Shinagawa Station|Shinagawa]]) # [[Chūō-Sōbu Line]] (for [[Nakano Station|Nakano]], [[Mitaka Station|Mitaka]]) # Chūō-Sōbu Line (for [[Ochanomizu Station|Ochanomizu]], [[Chiba Station|Chiba]]) There are three exits: East exit, West exit, and North exit. The latter two provide easy access to the Ōedo line. ===Toei=== The Toei Ōedo Line station has one underground island platform serving two tracks. ==Adjacent stations== {{j-railservice start}} {{j-route|route=Yamanote Line|col=YellowGreen}} {{j-rserv|service=-|previous=[[Harajuku Station|Harajuku]]|next=[[Shinjuku Station|Shinjuku]]}} {{j-route|route=Chūō-Sōbu Line|col=Yellow}} {{j-rserv|service=-|previous=[[Sendagaya Station|Sendagaya]]|next=Shinjuku}} {{j-route|route=Toei Oedo Line (E-26)|col=DarkMagenta|f=w}} {{j-rserv|service=-|previous=[[Kokuritsu-Kyōgijō Station|Kokuritsu-Kyōgijō]] (E-25)|next=Shinjuku (E-27)}} {{end box}} ==History== The station was first opened on 23 October 1906 by a private company as a station on the [[Chūō Main Line]], but was nationalized only a week later when the [[Japanese National Railways]] took over the company and all of its assessments. The underground [[Toei Ōedo Line]] station opened on 20 April 2000.<ref name="terada2002">{{cite book | last = Terada | first = Hirokazu |title = データブック日本の私鉄 (Databook: Japan's Private Railways) | publisher = Neko Publishing | date = July 2002 | location = Japan | pages = | isbn = 4-87366-874-3}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category}} * [http://www.jreast.co.jp/estation/station/info.aspx?StationCd=1654 JR East station information] {{ja icon}} * [http://www.kotsu.metro.tokyo.jp/subway/stations/yoyogi/e26.html Toei station information] {{ja icon}} {{Yamanote Line}} {{Chuo-Sobu Line}} {{Toei Oedo Line}} [[Category:Yamanote Line]] [[Category:Chūō-Sōbu Line]] [[Category:Toei Oedo Line]] [[Category:Stations of East Japan Railway Company]] [[Category:Stations of Tokyo Metropolitan Bureau of Transportation]] [[Category:Railway stations in Tokyo]] [[Category:Shibuya, Tokyo]]
